simplenlg.lexicon.lexicalitems
Class Verb

java.lang.Object
  simplenlg.lexicon.lexicalitems.ContentWord
      simplenlg.lexicon.lexicalitems.Verb
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable, LexicalItem
public class Verb
extends ContentWord

This class extends the ContentWord abstract class for verbs. Any instance of Verb is defined for the following inflectional rules:

past participle ( getPastParticiple() )

present tense ( getPast() )

present participle ("ing" form) ( getPresentParticiple() )

past tense ( getPresent3SG() )

Author:
agatt

Constructor Detail

Verb

public Verb(String baseform)
Constructs a new instance of Verb

Parameters:
baseform - The base form of this verb, possibly consisting of verb and particle separated by a space. If the baseform does contain a space between two substrings (e.g. "get up"), it is assumed to be a phrasal verb.
See Also:
Verb#Verb(String, String)

Parameters:
baseform - The baseform
part - The particle (assuming that this is a phrasal verb)

isCopular

public boolean isCopular()
Returns:

setConsonantDoubling

public void setConsonantDoubling(boolean consDoubling)
Set the "consonantDoubling" parameter for this Verb. If set to "true", this will mean that the final consonant of the verb is doubled whenever a rule applies where this is required.

Parameters:
consDoubling - Whether this Verb takes consonant doubling or not.

setIsNullAffixVerb

public void setIsNullAffixVerb(boolean neverInflected)
Set the "isNullAffixVerb" parameter for this verb. If set to "true", this means that the verb is never inflected in any form. Mostly used for the modal verbs "would", "should" etc.

Parameters:
neverInflected - whether this verb is ever inflected in any form

isNullAffixVerb

public boolean isNullAffixVerb()
Check if this verb ever takes inflections.

Returns:
true if this is a verb specified as never taking inflections in any form.

hasConsonantDoubling

public boolean hasConsonantDoubling()
Check if this verb takes consonant doubling.

Returns:
true if this verb takes consonant doubling

getPastParticiple

public List<AnchorString> getPastParticiple()
Processes the baseform of this Verb to obtain its "en" form. The form is stored in a field the first time this method is called, thus reducing processing overhead on subsequent calls.

This method involves a call to VerbInflection.PAST_PARTICIPLE in package simplenlg.lexicon.lexicalrules.rulesets.

Returns:
The past participle form (a String)

setPastParticiple

public void setPastParticiple(String ppart)
Sets the past participle form of this verb. Useful to override the default behaviour from the in-built rules.

Parameters:
ppart - - The past participle form

public List<AnchorString> getPresentParticiple()

This method involves a call to VerbInflection.ING_FORM in package simplenlg.lexicon.lexicalrules.rulesets.

Returns:
The "ing" form (a String).

getPast

public List<AnchorString> getPast()
Processes the baseform of this Verb to obtain its past tense form. In most cases The form is stored in a field the first time this method is called, thus reducing processing overhead on subsequent calls. This method involves a call to VerbInflection.PAST_TENSE in package simplenlg.lexicon.lexicalrules.rulesets.

Returns:
The past tense form (a String).

The form is stored in a field the first time this method is called, thus reducing processing overhead on subsequent calls.

This method involves a call to VerbInflection.PRESENT_TENSE in package simplenlg.lexicon.lexicalrules.rulesets.

Returns:
The 3rd person present tense form (a String).

getPresent

public List<AnchorString> getPresent(Person p,
                                     Number n)
Processes the baseform of this Verb to obtain the present tense form for a specific Person and Number combination. The default behaviour is to assume that all present tense forms except for 3rd person singular are identical to the baseform.

If using Lexicon, or any of its subclasses, this comes pre-loaded with a list of exceptions which take suppletive forms in some person/number combinations. E.g. the verb "to be" has different forms for 1st, 2nd and so on.

The form is stored in a field the first time this method is called, thus reducing processing overhead on subsequent calls. This method involves a call to VerbInflection.PRESENT_TENSE in package simplenlg.lexicon.lexicalrules.rulesets.

Returns:
The present tense form of a specific PersonNumber configuration (a String).

getPast

public List<AnchorString> getPast(Person p,
                                  Number n)
Processes the baseform of this Verb to obtain the past tense form for a specific PersonNumber combination.

If using Lexicon, or any of its subclasses, this comes pre-loaded with a list of exceptions which take suppletive forms in some person/number combinations. E.g. the verb "to be" has different forms for 1st, 2nd and so on.

The form is stored in a field the first time this method is called, thus reducing processing overhead on subsequent calls. This method involves a call to VerbInflection.PAST_TENSE in package simplenlg.lexicon.lexicalrules.rulesets.

Returns:
The past tense form of a specific PersonNumber configuration (a String).

getSubjunctive

public List<AnchorString> getSubjunctive()
Returns:
The subjunctive form of the verb (i.e. the one used in conditionals).

getInfinitive

public List<AnchorString> getInfinitive()
Returns:
The infinitive form (i.e. "to " followed by the base form and particle if any)
